review: We always sit in the bar. No wait. And great service from the bartender. Food is always hot when it gets to us. The beer is always cold and refreshing. The busser Lupe is a sweetheart! I really enjoy this location.

First of all let me say that I am definitely not one to review nor am I one to complain but this has definitely caused some frustration.  For the last 10 years I have always thrown a Christmas party for my employees. This year we chose to go to Red Robin near Hillsboro as we typically go to the one near Mall 205 in pdx. I called two locations, the one on TV highway and the one near 185th letting them know that I would like to host my Christmas party there, I do not need a banquet room I just need to make sure they have enough tables and chairs for my employees to have a good time. I also let them know that I would be putting this on my corporate credit card and that this tab ranges anywhere between $1000-$2000 for this type of event. (They will not make that much money in 1.5 any other way). The first location I called which was the TV highway location gave me a definite no and told me that they were not able to accommodate my request. ONE MONTH IN ADVANCE!! I did express to that manager (Sherri) that that seemed to be poor business and that I could not understand how any business with decline this amount of customers and a paid tab. I asked to speak to her manager. I left my number for a call back.  I then called the location on 188th and asked to speak with the manager Julie unfortunately Julie was not available as she is on vacation so I ended up speaking with the gentleman who was the manager of the kitchen named Pallino. Pallino told me the same thing Sherri from the other location told me and that was that they were not able to accommodate my request because of the hours indicated 5:30pm. I then asked to speak with his general manager and that is when he told me her name was Leanne stein. I called Leanne and left a detailed message and asked for a call back. I revived a calla round 40 mins later from Leanne.  So here it goes.... I cannot express enough the amount of unprofessionalism and lack of customer service that I have received from the general manager Leanne Stein. I am appalled that this restaurant would decline a party of 30 people because it was during their peek hours even though I called to to inform them a month in advance that I would be bring my staff to this location on 12/22/17 arriving at 5:30pm and would be done within 1.5hrs.  I was told they will not accommodate me and my employees as they will loose money on a number of tables that are not able to be turned over because of my large party. She tried to break it down to me in a way that felt was very condescending and not needed, she stated she would need six tables in order to accommodate my party and that's too many to lose money on. She said around 3 years ago they used to take larger parties but those larger parties would stay at the restaurant for way too long and they were not able to make the revenue that they would if they would just stop accommodating large parties. I felt like this is VERY poor business and I am not able to comprehend her reasoning from a business standpoint. There is no way that they are going to make in between $1000 and $2000 within an hour and a half no matter how many people they see. This is guaranteed payment!!! I asked if I could speak with her manager she said she did not have one I asked her where the corporate office was located she told me Denver Colorado she also told me that I could escalate this as far as I want but it will end up back on her desk as she is the regional general manager for this area. Her uncalled for comment about escalating this issue is why I am writing this review because I felt she was unprofessional and felt as if she felt she was the "Person in charge" of customer issues or complaints which I know is not the case.  I feel she should have done something to accommodate my large party and since I am not getting a call back from the corporate office I decided the only way for my concern to be seen is to leave a review on each location.  Thanks!

When in today around 2pm (tuesday), there was not a lot ppl so I assumed we would be in and out. To my surprise it took forever to get our food. Had to get another waitress attention to get refills and get to-go boxes since our waitress was rarely around ... then they complain about ppl not tipping enough smh.

Horribly slow service. Im standing in there lobby waiting right now. I called in and ordered 2 burgers and a salad, they said 10 minutes, I arrived 10 minutes later and they said not for another 10-15 minutes. They are so slow! If you ever order food from them, you should always give yourself an additional 10 minutes.

Another horrible experience with their Take out.  The food is never ever ever ready at the time they give me. I usually give it another 10 minutes because I know the food will be late. But low and behold, no matter what, I usually have to wait between 15 to 30 minutes for the food I ordered.  I am starting to think that this location - they don't really have a take out service as we know it. They just start to make the food when I show up.

It's....Red Robin. Neither spectacular or awful. It's consistent, reasonably priced and we can bring the kiddo until late at night - which is a huge bonus because we're late eaters.  It gets super duper busy around dinner time so we avoid it until 9pm. Typically around then you'll get seated in flash. Their menu is extensive - there's pretty much nothing you can't get here. They also have many options to make your meal healthy such as broccoli vs fries. I typically get the BLTA which is surprisingly delicious - fresh croissant and everything.  Service is usually pretty good, though sometimes a bit scatterbrained. There's a tablet on the table that I've never used to order food, but you can if you so want to. More importantly, you can pay your bill instead of waiting.  So...it's perfectly A-OK!

We haven't been to this location in a while because of previous horrible experiences. But today we were pleasantly surprised. It was Friday night, so it was pretty busy, but the wait was only about 10 min. It took our server a while to get to our table, but once she did, it was great! She was attentive, quick and super friendly. The best part was the food came fast - like the old Red Robin experience. Fast friendly service. And the food was great!

The atmosphere was cool here. They featured some cool collections of art on the walls and on the ceilings.  Food was okay, as expected. Burger a little smaller than what it showed in the advertisement. The waitress was nice and friendly.
I've been to this place a couple times and got my order wrong. Used to love Red Robin's ! Burgers are OK, nothing fresh or wow. The manager was nice enough to give me a refund.

Pretty crap service... to top it off they had all the Hispanics in one small section of the restaurant.... my girl went into the bathroom and apparently one of the employees were smoking meth in one of the bathroom stal.

It's 103° outside and easily 99°in here. The A/C is broken on the hottest day of the year but rather than let us know, they seat us and ignore us as we wither away. The table next to us has 8 children and 3 adults, not exaggerating, and the wait staff is literally visibly sweating. This is some kind of hell.

Tonight our family had dinner at this Red Robin location to celebrate my 11 year old daughter's cheerleading national championship win. (She is writing this review with me and asked me to add that.)   Our family was waited on by Cory with the mustache as our little girl called him. Not only was our food yummy but our waiter Cory was absolutely outstanding. His attention to detail was impeccable. His awareness  of when we needed beverages or condiments as well as to go containers without being alerted was spooky. As if he had a 6th sense. This guy is a god damn mind reader! He   .how much barbecue sauce was on my husbands boneless      Buffalo wings and he put some extra sauce in a cup on the side of the basket! He stated that he was not comfortable with the amount of sauce on the wings and he took the initiative to remedy the problem on his own.  So to the Waiter we are referring to as Cory with the Mustache..... We salute you Aka : Cory Jensen  Dear Red Robin, This guy is management material and no we are not related and had never met him before tonight. We asked him for his full name to add him to this Yelp review
Always great food and service.  Lots to choose from.  Been going there since 2006.

My experiences here have been meh up until today thanks to the awesome guy who helped us out, Tom. He kept an eye on our drinks and refilled my girls lemonade without even being asked! He offered the bottomless fry refill as well which we always have had to ask for.  We tried the Mac and cheese in the past and it was ew so we stick to the burgers and fries now. They are always delish as well as the chicken strips! The burgers were done to our liking, juicy and they have a variety of burger fillings.. I was impressed with this Tom fellow. He was on top of our service and I saw he interacted well with the other tables he had. And he made sure that I knew the "biggest beer" was a huge mug, sadly I was not able to finish my second mug  The only criticism I have is the children's menu being in Spanish. My daughter does not read Spanish so I had to read it to her and she likes reading the menu options herself.. Other than that we had a very pleasant time :-)  Ps Our server did not hand out the menus.. the Host did.

Red Robin used to be one of my favorite burger joints but not anymore.  Their burgers seem to have gotten smaller and less flavorful.  For today's visit their once fantastic fries were limp and under-seasoned.  My wife always requests her burgers well-done with no pink and 75% of the time they can't get this right.  At this point we will have to think twice about even going for the free birthday burger.

Was super excited about coming to town where Red Robin was located. Not so impressed with this location. Bathrooms were a mess. One stall had no t.p the other was plugged up. Paper towels every where, trash over flowing. Service was awful. Fries were cold. No silverware or napkins. We were celebrating 2 birthdays. Took so long for special desert before our 3 yr old need to leave for bed. Waited for ever for bill. Tried to pay it with iPad which wouldn't take my card. Asked for assistance to get ignored. Ended up leaving cash on the table and leaving with out even a thank you or acknowledgement . We will never visit here again sooo sad to say bye bye Red Robin. Not my favorite anymore.

I am 17 years old, and whenever I come to this Red Robin location I am sat in the designated "kids" section of the restaurant. My friends and I then have to sit next to crying toddlers and large, loud families. For our age, I do not think it is fair for us to be seen as children. Other than that, service is adequate.

We're a fan of RR and this is our current go to spot for great burgers and bottomless fries. We usually head straight to the bar because there's no wait for seating, the TVs are easy to see, and the awesome bartender and servers like Samantha and Jasmine always perk our day up. We almost always order the same entrees there, and it's amazing that the servers recognize us, remember our usual, and go out of their way to make every dining experience pleasant.

Maybe it is me, maybe I expect too much out of a chain.  The service at the bar was decent, she was busy but checked on us often, but the food was ok... but to say Red Robin Yum.... it isn't that good.

We normally sit in the bar.. its just easier. Servers are always friendly and smiling. The last time we went though I got the cobb salad. I was extremely disappointed. They raised the pricing and cut the salad in half. Absolutely not worth that kind of money.

Racism still exists I guess, at least it does at this RR. And yes, I'm writing this review while having dinner at RR because we didn't get any attention from the servers.  Came here on Tuesday night with my cousin who was also Asian, yep, Asian hangs out with each other is a thing. We got seated on the bar which is the closest area. We closed our menu like 15mins and nobody came to check on us. The only thing that I got on the table was menu, not even a cup of water. If it was busy, I wouldn't have blamed them. There were 7 people on the bar and they already got their food. We still waited for someone to come and take our orders. Meanwhile, 3 of the waitresses were chatting, to each other and customers and then to each other again. We were so close to leave but my cousin was barely able to walk because she was so hungry so I decided to stay. It took them 15mins to finish their conversations with others to take our orders- unhappily. The lady who took our orders didn't even want to look at our faces, she just looked at the screen and nodded after I said anything for my order. No "thank you" , no "do you need anything else" or anything, just walked away like we interrupted their conversations.  We smiled, we waited to be seated and we didn't show attitudes because we are nice people and always try to become friendly customers. I had no idea what I did wrong to be treated like this. The guys who sat next to us were taken his orders before us by the way.  I'm a very positive Yelper who always try to ignore negativity and give 5 stars for all the restaurants where I have been to, apparently not this time.  The Asian racism might be my assumption but with everything that I observed today, I guess it must be it.  Me coming back? Not a chance.

I love the food here and normally very happy. but I'm not sure about the newer tablet thing. i feel like we are not checked on as often and no one told me about how to use it to order, reorder or call a server when you need something.  love the idea of it but it hasnt been the best experience since they added the tablet. :/

Been here several times. Always very busy, and have to wait for a table. The wait staff are very friendly, often seem to be overworked. They usually do their best to keep up, but they seem a bit overwhelmed.  The food is always great, nothing like a good burger or some chicken strips.

Red Robin sure has slipped... There's no consistency! I ordered the same dish as I ordered at the Sherwood location, and it was dry, bland, and had half the sauce. To top it all off, my Coke sat empty for the entire second half of our meal. I guess they either don't like to give refills or their servers need more training? Sadly, my kids like this place but anywhere else has better service... I hate giving them money

I've been to this Red Robin quite a few times because it's close, the food's on par for Red Robin, and the atmosphere is kid friendly. That being said, the last few times I have been here we've had to wait almost an hour for our food. I'm afraid to go back for a sit down meal because of the long wait. I've done takeout and had no problems.
Very clean,  very friendly crew.  Food came out perfect! Ordered extra fries they came out fast hot,  and delicious! Yumm!

This Red Robin location was okay. We got there around dinner time, and as expected, there was a wait. After about 15-20 minutes we were seated. I ordered the crispy chicken burger (which is my go to burger whenever dining at red robin). The wait time was pretty long to get our food, but I was there with two other friends so we didn't mind too much. What I did mind was that the server who was serving us kept coming back asking if we were finished, even as we had food on our plates. I noted that there were still several open tables around when she started pestering us, and that got on my nerves. I don't like to be rushed when I'm eating. After feeling like we weren't wanted there, we left. I would give the place two stars, but I guess you can't blame a place based on the actions of one bad server. Onto the topic of the food, the crispy chicken burger was decent. I liked the fries though!

I've been to this location twice. I ve encountered friendly service and a great uplifting atmosphere.  The food was delicious and cooked properly. I have no complaints and will return here again.  The quality of the food is top notch. A great place for a fun, festive meal.

Yummy and the waitress was attentive...until trying to pay with cash instead of the kiosk, it took about 10 minutes AFTER she walked away with my money to get change. I'll remember to bring my card next time

Got an e-mail from the manager, "like she actually cared" but of course no follow through. Just like the service, it's all self serv, go somewhere else if you want service and good food. Here is a copy of what I got from the manager, she of course does not have the time to follow up herself, she pawns it off on someone else so some poor smuck can take the fall. Katie A.   Owner       Subject: RE: Your Review    "Thanks, Gordon. Please let us know if you don't hear from one of our Team Members in the next day or two. Katie Red Robin"

The worst experience I've ever had at a Red Robin... And I ordered take out! We called to place our order tonight and were put on a 5 minute hold. Fine, it's New Years Day and other restaurants are closed so I'm sure it is busy in there. We placed our order for a Royal Red Robin Burger and Fish and Chips. Nothing crazy. We were told it would be 15-20 minutes. Great! We arrived 25 minutes later. My husband went inside to grab the order. He was "greeted" by the bartender and asked if he had a To-Go order and what his name was. (Also I must point out that he was the only to-go customer). She then did nothing with that information and continued to very slowly help the barside patrons. She then told my husband (5 minutes later) that somebody would help him shortly. Another waitress approached my husband and asked his name. She said "great, let me get it together for you" At this point he had been inside for about 10 minutes (so we are sitting at 35 minutes of that 15-20 minute window). 5 minutes later the waitress returned with our food. My husband paid and we went on our way with our food 45 minutes after ordering. We made the 5 minute drive home and opened our boxes. Everything was hardly warm and the fish and chips didn't come with tartar sauce. So we are sitting here with soggy cold fish with no dip and a burger that needed to be microwaved. I tried to eat the fish and it tasted like cooled fryer oil. Will not return to this location.

I wish I could give this restaurant minus stars!  The food was horrible!  50 minutes after we arrived, we finally got our food and it was cold.  My Prime Rib dip was missing the au jus and the sweet potato fries were half full.  My plate looked like somebody else's leftover plate!  Very unappetizing!   The only positive thing I can say is that the manager was nice enough to take my order off of the bill after I complained.  She said that their manager that is responsible for the final product was obviously not doing his job and that they would look into it.  I certainly won't be back and wanted to warn anyone else looking at this location....stay away!  There are a LOT of other bad ratings for this location, so do yourself a favor and find another hamburger joint!  This is one to miss for sure!

Red Robin makes pretty standard hamburgers. The sad thing is that you can't go rarer than a medium. Which speaks volumes for the meat they use. I like to eat my hamburgers and steaks medium rare to even rare, of course without getting sick... However, I do love their royal red robin burger, the egg masks the overcooked meat for  me.
Always delicious sms tasty burgers, and there reward programme is really good compared to other places tasty give you nothing in return for spending your hard earned money in their establishment.
Bad service not happy 15 minutes to get menus at the bar served other people that came in after us. I think she's blind or just stupid.

We normally like this restaurant OK burgers OK service OK prices. With that being said this new table top computer pay system that has little games to play. WATCH OUT the games cost money they dont tell you when you start playing. We played 1 stupid trivia game and when we got home to look over the bill it cost $2.00. they need to tell people if you play it will cost you

If the management gave one little shit about the rest of the customers instead of spending sooooo much time with the complaining couple who just ordered two fkn salads. We went in there happy to eat there , looking forward to our meal and left disappointed. The complainers went in not happy, complained to the managers for about 20 minutes and will still be dissatisfied. Great job on turning others away. Oh yeah I have never ever got my " bottomless fries" refilled even when I ask!!!! Wtf

Went here during my lunch and was sooo disappointed. The service was good and attentive... But the food did not match the people. I ordered a veggie burger with a side of onion rings and the burger was gross! It looked and tasted like it was microwaved for under a minute. It was less-than-lukewarm and did not taste good at all. The whole burger was lukewarm. I tried my best to scarf down half but did not enjoy it. The only saving grace was the onion rings... Hot and delicious! Wish I just ordered a plate of those.

The 1 stars is for the company who brought in the new manager there.  She apparently has been firing servers for really ridiculous reasons and it's affecting customers desires to want to dine there.  Many people come because of the friendly staff, it's unfortunate that they are treated with such negativity.   I now dine at the RR off 185th in Beaverton.

Good food, good service. We come here regularly and always sit in the bar when possible to avoid the children. The burgers and other food are usually perfectly done and the drinks are usually awesome.  On this particular night, my burger was a bit over done and it took a bit longer than usual for the food, but we didn't care much since Tracy kept our drinks full and us happy.  Over all of our visits so far, still 4 stars and we'll be back. :-)

AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE EBOLA!!! Here for child's 13th birthday.  Greeted by a charming hostess and everything went down from there. Waiter didn't take the father's drink order, never re-filled anyone's glass, no "bottomless fries" and birthday boy didn't get his food!!! His hamburger arrived as everyone else was done. He then didn't want to eat.  Table behind us spilled a drink all over the floor. Wait staff put up a warning sign but never cleaned up the mess. Manager sat in the corner talking with someone.  Store owner should fire everyone and start over.

The service at the bar is terrible. Our first bartender was great, but as soon as Kim started its like we were invisible, no greeting and not once did she check on us. We even used the call server feature on the Ziosk and still no acknowledgement, the light stopped flashing because they did not check on us at all. It's very disappointing because this is normally a place my friends and I enjoy coming to. It wasn't till we pressed the button on another Ziosk that Jordan, who just started, came to help us. So we were not acknowledged for 45+ minutes. I would give zero stars if that was an options based on this experience.

this is an update for the review that I did for the sunset Esplanade Red Robin restaurant. Three days after I wrote the review I got a message from someone that was interested to hear about my experience. And wanted to documents what happened so it could be used for better training purposes with there employees. And of course they message many apologies. I think it's a wonderful gesture to take interest in your customers experience . And I appreciate them taking the time to get back to me. So they asked for my contact information and I gladly give it to them. I just got a phone call today and an email from a woman that works at this particular Red Robin location she was extremely apologetic very sympathetic. And wanting to make the situation right. and I didn't ask for this but they gave me a $25 gift card for any Red Robin location. I declined and said that I did not wanted I didn't ask for it that's not what I was looking for. But I appreciated the gesture and she insisted but she gave me the electronic gift card anyway.  So I guess only time will tell if this situation comes of anything. The woman I spoke with today gave me a gesture of faith so I will return the favor and return to the restaurant sometime. I just hope that when my family and I go there that there are changes I hope their staff treat the customers like human beings and not just rushed cash cows. I'll let everyone know how it goes.

Someone from Red Robin contacted me after our less than stellar trip and invited us back to give them another shot. We had an absolute blast, service was great and the food came timely. We've been back many times since and every time we leave satisfied. Must have been an off day on our first visit.

finally!!!!! a red robin that knows what customer service is all about!!!! not only was our server lorene friendly, she was on top of things through out our lunch. lorene is a pro! we brought family from out of town and my unko is very picky and lorene handled him like a pro. she smiled and accommodated him. and he was very impressed his particular order.

Place has really gone down hill. Good enough food-when you actually get it. I'm writing this as we've waited almost 30min for our food. Fries are always doubled cooked or cold.  Truth is-go find a different place to good to. It's good for a last resort. Or if you're not in a hurry.

***THIS REVIEW IS FOR THIS LOCATION (TV HWY/HILLSBORO) ONLY*** Our family has been Red Robin loyal for many years. We are in a RR at least twice a month. So, it is easily our favorite place to eat. That said, we have visited this location many times but up until recently we have had a good experience. The last several times we visited, the service was slow and the food came out cold. We don't tend to complain about food or service because we think maybe it's a bad day or someone called in sick. But it's unusual for us to rarely see a server or to be waiting so long to get our drinks, get our food, get the order correct, or to get napkins. We will be visiting the Tanasbourne or TV HWY/217 locations from now on.

Red Robin serves gluten free options, which is a big reason why I come here. Over the last year or so RR has gone through a re-branding. Out went Red, the large bird costume, that used to visit each location on a weekly basis. The menu was revamped with alcoholic beverages moved to the front of the menu. The wait time has increased too, though it's not uncommon at this location to have a long wait with empty tables in the restaurant.  If ordering soup or salad before my meal, it will often come out just before our food arrives. When they get it right, the food is delicious. Having a food allergy, I have never gotten sick while eating here. One of my favorite soups, French onion, now comes out in a tiny square dish with hardly any broth in the dish, which is very disappointing. Recently this location added an electronic tablet at every table. Now people can order electronically and be bombarded by online adds for games people can play for a small charge while sitting at the table. I find these units annoying and refuse to use them. I have enough electronic devices in my life, I like to put mine away at dinner. I will continue to eat here knowing I can get a safe gluten free meal, however, I don't eat here as often as I used to.

Oh my gosh. I called this location and Sarah answered the phone. I was calling to let them know (at 1pm) that we would be coming in later that evening with a party of 8 at 6pm to celebrate MY birthday. I was trying to do a courtesy by letting them know since that is a busy time and I assume since we're a larger party that is something they would have to prepare for. But, before I could even finish what I was saying, the woman who answered the phone interrupted me by saying, "We're first come first serve and don't do reservations so maybe you should get here early." I was shocked and that was the end of our conversation. Rude!

What happened to bottomless fries?  The amount of fries you get with a grilled sandwich is pathetic. The mini wedge salad comes on a plate that's so small 1/4 of the salad ends up on the table.  Watch out for the games on their new electronic table ordering stands, my 14 year old accidentally hit the "pay 1.99 for unlimited games" and all the waitress said was "yes that's tricky" so that's almost a scam!!!  The happy birthday sundae and song were still fun and the server was very nice and attentive but sadly the food had gone downhill.

I put in an order to go last night and the lady was just flat out rude. I believe her name was Ingraham or something along that line. I asked her a simple question about the new crab cake burger and she responded with an attitude. She shouldn't be in customer service and I will NEVER order anything from here again. I rather drive 15 minutes out to a different red robin than go back here.

Our booth smelled like it had been cleaned.  The table did not look very clean either as it had some funky prints of left over food.  This is the second consecutive time my burger is pink and this one was pink and cold.  Upon sending it back, the server could not help herself and I would see it pained her to send it back.  That being said, the manager had it remade and it was was very good!  He also provided me with dessert on the house.  For his gesture I am grateful, but given prior experience I have really experienced better.

Love the remodel. Place looks much better.  Food is still underwhelming unfortunately. Seems they've made several attempts to class up their menu with fancier burgers, but the one I had last night was so bad. The bacon was hard as a rock. The bun was soggy from so much sauce on it. I barely choked down half of it before just giving up and filling up on fries instead.  You can remodel all you want red robin, your food is still mediocre at best

Went here on a late night date this Saturday hoping to have a satisfying bruschetta chicken Burger when we arrived 25 minutes before closing they took about 5 minutes to seat us and after we were seated , we were completely ignored ! :( boohoo! We had to walk over to sharis .. Oh well customer service wins almost everytime.

Good, same as every other red Robin. I'm reviewing this one because I waited an hour and a half on one night I went for food. It was a bit busy but just for having to wait like that they gave me 50 percent off my bill without me even asking, I thought that was really cool and a good way to get customers to stay customers.

I'm not a big Red Robin fan, but I do love their chili.  I showed up with my boys to have a chili and blta, and lo and behold, the menu has changed.  Chili is gone.   Now, I don't care for their burgers at ALL, but I really didn't have any other choices that jumped out at me--so I ordered a Royal Burger.  It came, and as I had assumed, I didn't care for it.   Now this is not the specific restaurant's problem--this is a chain.  The waitress, who was totally helpful and very attentive, noticed I wasn't really eating and asked if there was a problem.  I told her that I really didn't care for their burgers--and it was fine.  The next thing I know, the manager comes over to explain the menu change, to apologize for it, and to let me know they would remove the burger from our bill.  Wow.  That was unexpected and nice. Every time we have been back since, the service has been just amazing.  If I liked RR better, I would be rating this a 5!

Having now been to about ten different Red Robins in three states, my experience has been roughly the same at each location--and this is good--consistency is a good thing with big chains as one always knows what to expect. Tonight, Wife N. is off doing her own thing with a group of ladies, and so I had the kids.  We hit Red Robin for dinner, Friday night, 6:05 PM. Headed in the door to see roughly 40 people in the foyer waiting to be called for a seat.  Surprisingly, despite the crowd, we were seated within about 15 minutes.  Our server took our orders quickly and with a smile. Food arrived at about T+20 minutes from walking in the door---really fast and spot-on even with this large a crowd.  As always, the food is exactly as expected--my son's Kid's Mac and Cheese with Fries and daughter's Bacon Cheeseburger "hold the cheese" were both identical to the last thirty-some-odd times they ordered it (our kids have a fondness for the same thing every time).   I decided to try something new and went for the Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad.  Great salad--the chicken had a mild spicing to it, but it was lovely heating it up with these little fried Jalapeno disks that came with it.  I think I may have that one again.   In and out in 40 minutes--service was excellent.

This is the first time I have not received the drink 30-45 minutes after ordering.  The explanation from the waitress was she was waiting for us to order food.  This does not make sense.  Basically,  the service was slow, very slow.  It always is, unless we go to the bar.  At least there the do not ignore you.

A solid 3 1/2. My girlie friends and I sat in the bar to grab a bit and a beverage before hitting the movies. Our server was extremely personable and made a great burger recommendation. She knew we were on a schedule so she brought our drinks and food over promptly and had no issue dividing the bill. I'm kinda waiting for this place to have a make over. It feels "retro" and NOT in a good way. The theme is a bit tired...good for the kids, I guess, if that is the clientele you are trying to attract, but it would be cool if they revamped the bar to feel a bit more "grown up" and away from the stares of tots watching your every sip.

To crowded, to loud, service slow. Had the blue cheese burger and the French dip, both not worth the price or the wait. Also had the onion ring tower would have been good if you started eating it when you were already drunk. All I can say is their are better burgers in the P-town area.
After my previous post on here, RR contacted me and encouraged me to come back so they may try again. I must say, I was impressed. Great food, awesome staff, fantastic atmosphere. Nice job guys!

7 empty tables and three hostess at the front if the restaurant.  We left after waiting for more than 10 minutes and after giving the manager a peice if my mind. She tried to wrap her head around it but it is a direct reflection of the managment when your waitstaff and  hostesses stand around with empty tables making guests wait.
This service at this location is about half of the neighboring Red Robin in tanasbourne, not quite as busy as a result. Food is hot and tasty though for a good family outing.

I hesitantly checked into Red Robin via the Yelp smartphone app when we were here 2 weeks back, instantly knowing I'd regret it.  You see, I'm not one to ignore Yelp's little reminder that you need to review a restaurant that you checked into.  Yes, you can kill the little reminder, but the OCD portion of my brain won't allow me to do that.  Maybe some combination of therapy and chemicals can help me...?  On a similar note, I intentionally avoided checking into Red Lobster last night for that very same reason.  HAH, I shall foil you yet, Yelp check-in-reminder. So, as the eloquent Bob M. put it, "what were we doing in here?  Getting a fine burger and good fries."  Yep, same.  I wanted to try the "Tavern Double" I'd seen advertised recently, because I'm a good, traditional American consumer.  I typically avoid RR's burgers because I don't think they're impressive in any way, shape or form.  I will admit that the Tavern Double was fine; even better than their standard burger offerings, I dare to say.  I like Red's steak fries.  I do NOT recommend their "Three-for-all", which is the aforementioned steak fries, onion straws and sweet potato fries.  It's not necessary to get fancy, just stick with the tried and true steak fries.  Back to the burger: 2 smallish patties, cheese, lettuce, tomato and thousand island.  That's really it.  I think it's Red's ode to an In-N-Out double double.  You know what, it works.  It's fine.  It's not in the same league as a double double or a Rachel's double, but if you're trapped at Red Robin via gunpoint, it's a good burger choice. *Cue the Debbie Downer music* Three-For-All appetizer: 2,764 mg of sodium Red's Tavern Double: 1,086 mg of sodium That's just the sodium.  No, I didn't come close to eating even half of the appetizer, but still, I'm confident I pushed the 2k barrier for salt.  YUCK.  On top of that, I noticed that their seasoning (in those nifty jumbo dispensers at each table) contain MSG.  Don't let their website fool you: anything that says "hydrolyzed protein" IS, in fact, a variation on MSG.  So, is this an indictment of Red Robin?  No, not at all.  RR is FINE, in moderation.  For me, in this case, "moderation" = 2x a year, at the most.

I have and will continue to go here but the place is nothing more then A-OK. The establishment is what is found in any of their other Red Robins found anywhere. Its a cookie cutter place with the food following step for step. Some of it is good but its almost all meh.  The prices are OK and I usually find myself going here when they have a great deal going on. I would tend to stay away from most of their appetizers. The burgers are good I like some of their options including the whiskey river burger.  I can't say this is my first option when it comes to restaurants but its an option late nights and the staff here works hard and is pleasant enough.  I think most people would rate this place as a 2-4 star place depending on their experience but it has never been a black and white place its neither horrible or amazing. It just is.
Just had a delicious dinner and a fantastic server named Rachael.  Rachael did an amazing job with our large party, simply amazing!!

After getting our drinks brought to us, I saw that my freckled lemonade had an added addition of two flies in it. When I informed the server there was no words exchanged on his part, no apology, waive the fee, discount etc. I was handed another drink though which I was too nervous to drink. The food was ok (and fly and rat free that I could see ;) ) Good atmosphere for families who want to dine out. Would I eat there again? Not likely

The kids love the place. Generally a good place, but the prices are really starting to get a bit much. Almost $10 for a burger. That's a bit steep. Unlimited fries is nice.  Soup and Salad combo is now almost the same as burger.

This location used to be pretty good, but the past few times I have gone there have not been great. This evening I went with family and we were seated quickly, but it all went downhill from there. Our server was not too friendly and it took a loooooong time for our food to come out. We asked our server for ranch and she came back with that and a refill of juice for my son pretty quickly. Things were looking up? Nope. The burgers were burned, like charred and bitter burned. Fries were cold. My son ordered sweet potato fries (and received such a small portion of sweet potato fries!) and we were planning on getting a refill on them, especially since there is an upcharge from regular fries. However, our server was nowhere to be found. Like a ghost. We had finished our food, sodas had long since run dry (no refills on those, either), and we figured it wasn't worth waiting another 20+ minutes to get that fry refill. I understand that it's Friday night and they are busy, but an "I'm sorry this took so long" would have gone a long way. Disappointed and not planning on returning.

Don't let the name "burgers" fool you. While they are famous for their burgers they do offer salads, various chicken items, deli style wraps and even a Quesadilla.  You walk in and most of the time if the young teens aren't chit chatting about some pool party or their boyfriends/girlfriends myspace picture you are greeted and seated.   You have lots of items to choose from. All the burgers come with steak fries that are salted with a seasoning salt. (like Johnny's season salt from Costco) Eat them all and they will bring more. Though they are susposto bring them to you automatically there are times where you have to catch them to bring more out and by then you may be done with your food.  Don't get me wrong though they do at times actually pay attention.  Prices are average ranging around $10. Place is packed with families with kids and high schoolers who seem to stay long after they are done eating taking over tables when there are people who are waiting to be seated.  They have take out, so you can go to the website and view the online menu for this location and give the place a call. Orders are almost always ready with in 15 minutes of placing the order. Designated parking spots for those who take out and you pick up your orders at the bar. Over all its a decent place, but way over hyped by the young 13-17 year old generation.

I like the atmosphere here. The menu has plenty of great stuff on it. Great place to take the kids. There is a mini arcade near the entrance. Little ones get crayons and a coloring book, and can have a balloon if they want. I have always received good service there and have been satisfied when I leave.

Food is adequate as with most Red Robins, but it's pretty easy to sense a culture of corporatism here (all they care about is money).  The wait staff has always been friendly and efficient but I'm guessing not much thought is given to the managers this place hires.  Depending on where one sits, it's pretty easy to overhear conversations, like a manager criticizing his waiter or waitress for not selling enough desserts.  Listen up:  Not everyone wants dessert or an appetizer.  Stop forcing your wait staff to oversell at my table.  For an aging chain where the décor is dated and the menu doesn't change much, I would think you'd be more focused on honest service and occasionally updating the menu.  And I'm gonna guess there's a high turnover of cooks here or cooks who just don't care.  When there are food runners/other wait staff to help deliver my food, hot entrees that arrive cold are rarely the fault of my waitress.  Oh and the clientele at this location.. wow.  I've witnessed a woman go off loudly about something (her boyfriend) and another woman throw her sandwich at her husband/boyfriend.  I used to eat at this chain regularly, but I'm not spending anymore of my money on them. And this one in particular is.. yuk.
Excellent service. Not bad for a chain restaurant, although I am not excited to pay $3 for iced tea
I wanna thank the manager. After my last review, she called me personally and apologized for what had happened and asked me to give it another try. Thanks!

Alas, the time has come and gone when the original Red Robin in Seattle served some of the best burgers around. What's left since the original owner sold out so many years ago is a pale shadow of who they were.  This was never more apparent than from my visit the other day. I ordered a Crispy Chicken Sandwich.  This is something I'd been doing for a while here, and while the service has gone steadily downhill for some years now, I was still a fan of that sandwich.   Ten minutes went to fifteen; I asked the waitress twice what was going on.  She told me (three times, actually) that my order was 'coming up shortly'.   At the twenty-minute mark, I asked to see the manager.  He confessed that my order had been lost; then screwed-up by one of the seeming legions of new employees which come through their revolving door on a monthly basis.  He said it would be out 'really soon'. At the thirty minute mark, I asked to see him again.  He apologized, then told me that my meal would be 'free', and that the re-make 'looked like a hockey puck'. I said, "You don't know me, and I don't know you.  I could be a food-writer.  You don't know that.  Do you consider this an acceptable level of service?"   I could feel my inner Robert Irvine coming out. "No, and that's why your meal is free," he said, rather impatiently.  He turned around and walked back to the relative safety of the kitchen (dealing with customers clearly isn't this guy's forte). I dropped $2 on the table for the iced-tea I'd been drinking, and left. I won't be back.  You shouldn't; either. There are plenty of places to get a sandwich.  This ain't it.
Bottom-less fries What a bunch of lies Oh they'll give you the first through third Then they disappear despite what you heard Look your food is bland Nothing to see here, free is not this land
Service was slow and the drinks were just "meh". The burgers were decent, but for the money I believe you get more attention and better food at Helvetia Tavern.

What a horrible RR experience! I was meeting someone for lunch, so I went in early to get a table and get drinks ordered. I sat in the front of the restaurant near the podium for over 5 minutes before the "manager," Barb, even came over and acknowledged me. I went and sat at the table, met the person I was waiting for, decided on drinks and food... All before ever having spoken with a waiter. Seriously. Ten minutes and several passing-server-eye-contacts later, we got up and left. What a colossal waste of a lunch hour. We went to a restaurant next door where we were immediately seated, ordered drinks, and food arrived promptly. If you absolutely MUST eat at Red Robin, take the extra 15 minutes to drive to the Tanasbourne location, it will be a huge time-saver.

The worst service I have ever received. I was ignored by the server many times that I decided to get up and leave. Then she had said she was just about to come to the table. Ya right... The place was basically empty and she had made eye contact with me and walked past my table numerous times without saying a word. So I got heated and told her off saying I was not going to spend my money on crappy service. I will never come back to this restaurant ever again. You're better off at the 185th location.

Good food, service well it sucked! The person waiting on us spent way more time with other tables. We would ask for something like extra napkins and 10 minutes later she would come by and ask if we needed anything else? Oh I don't know how about the F***ING napkins. Hey RR Manager how about some retraining or more staff ya git.

I'm a big fan of the river city chicken wraps here, actually it's what I get 80% of the time. The service is usually a toss up. I will in fact avoid it if I see people waiting outside because if they get backed up, I don't have faith in them catching up.  They get some new menu items from time to time but keep the stuff I like. The Red Robin Royalty card is semi worth it, at times you'll get a free appetizer or on your birthday you'll get a free burger.

We have frequented this particular RR for years and service has usually been at least tolerable, but not this last time. I called earlier to give a heads up for a large group (12), was told they don't take reservations  (which I knew and wasn't asking for). I explained I was asking what time I should be there. Was told our group would be "on the list" for hospitality to keep an eye out for table arrangements. No need to show up super early, we wouldn't be SEATED until everyone in the party arrived. The first to arrive checked in at the front, was told "we don't take reservations and don't watch for tables, we just put your name down when the first person gets here." Fine, but I would have shown up earlier had I been told to, in order to put our name down. We proceeded to wait OVER AN HOUR for a table. No fewer that 75-100  people were seated, fed in that time. I spoke with management asking why people were being seated before our group (at tables that could've been combined to accommodate our group)  and was told they were waiting for ONE PARTICULAR GROUP to finish to put two tables together. That is ridiculous and terrible service. We've had long waits before and the manager has always offered a compensation, such as free appetizer, and nothing was given this time when it was their fault we waited so long. We will not be going back here, and will not be recommending it either.

Where do I begin... I waited until the next day to write this because I was so angry that I was concerned it would effect what I wrote. To be honest the burgers that my husband and I ordered were really good, once we got them. We were seated right away (because they were not busy three waiters/waitresses were waiting with the hostess doing nothing) but then waited 20 minutes to have our drink order taken. Another 20 minutes to put in an order for food. My daughter was so hungry she was tearing up. When food finally came 30 minutes later our appetizer did not come first. My daughter's Mac & cheese was soupy and cold. The waitress never came back to make sure we were happy with it. Lucky for us but unfortunately for the table behind us they also ordered the Mac & cheese and called the manager over. So we got the manager right after them. Now this may be the only person who cares if the restaurant does well. He was very accommodating and the only reason I give this place two stars instead of one. He comped the app and my daughter's meal and half of the rest. But unfortunately there was no saving us as customers at this Red Robin. This was there third chance. It was an awful 2 hour experience. We ended heading to the Shari's next door to get a to-go-order for my daughter who was understandably still hungry.

We are no strangers to Red Robin. The food is yummy, and the service is usually good at this location. I say "usually" because our hostess just stared at me when we walked in. She literally didn't say a word to me. I told her how many people and waited to be walked to a table. Seriously? What do they pay you for? Way to bring the only good Red Robin in the area down a star lady. You need to learn a thing or two about customer service.The waitress tonight is great however, and turned the night around with great service and recommendations.

I've liked all the Red Robin's that I've been to in the past but something, just something, is wrong with this one? My friend and I both couldn't put our fingers on it? Strange. It's called Red Robin, it looks like Red Robin, but it didn't seem like Red Robin. Make any sense? Probably not. Well, after a day of running around, we decided to stop by Hale's to get some omelettes. Unfortunately, we turned in one stop too soon and ended up at the wrong strip mall. We were both starving after running errands all day and just wanted to get our grub on. And Red Robin was right there next to us so we just decided to forgo the omelettes and eat burgers instead. It was an off hour so there were only about 6-7 other tables in the place. We were promptly greeted and seated. We both already knew what we wanted so we just placed our orders. I got the bacon cheeseburger (provolone) medium with garlic fries and my buddy got the avocado bacon with garlic fries. I asked the server to bring us some fries beforehand because we were starving. A short while later, he came out with our drinks and the fries. Very prompt service. Then less than 10 minutes after that, out came the burgers. Herein lies the problem, I think. It looked like a Red Robin burger, but it didn't taste like one. Now I'm not saying they have the best burgers because quite frankly, they're far from it, but their burgers are usually decent. I go there for the garlic fries anyway. But my buddy and I both agreed that there was something wrong with both of our burgers. Was it the meat? Or the bun? The veggies? A combination of things? Who knows because we couldn't figure it out. It just didn't taste good, not even decent.  I probably wouldn't visit this RR again because there are two other locations near my place. The service was good but the burgers weren't. It's a shame.
Service was slow tonight.  Tok almost 30 minutes for our food to come out.  French onion soup was too salty.  But my sandwich was really good as always.  New renovations are really nice.

My husband loves to come here for their sweet potatoe fries! My daughter specifically asks to come here for her birthday because of one waitress- Rachael. She absolutely loves her! She is very friendly and on top of drink refills and meals coming out in a timely fashion! She knows what to offer for those that are eating clean, which is a top priority for me. Overall, my family always has a great time and a great meal at this Red Robin!

This location has consistently bad service. My experience in the last two visits (6/17 & 7/13) have been food not coming out as ordered, food coming out slow, & not being able to get the waitresses attention because she never comes back. The waitresses in particular are unenergetic, inattentive and with flat personalities that really don't care. I feel this is limited to the Hillsboro location as I found the Tanasbourne/185th location to have excellent food service!

We eat at Red Robin weekly. It's convenient and moderately priced. That being said... one week we had to order take out b/c 2 of our kids had bronchitis and they were going to try and eat their favorite meal, Mac and cheese. When we ordered and asked for the Mac and cheese refills to be included the server argued with us stating that they don't give the refill on to-go orders. Longer story short, the GM had to get involved, eventually we were able to order. Tonight we ordered Togo again, the order was incorrect, they said they would remake it if we came back. No offer to compensate for the incorrect food, fuel or time. Those were just two instances, I could go on... I won't. I need to move my family closer to Helvetia Tavern. Great service, locally owned and incredible food.

Ah, good ol' Red Robin.  This is a great stand-by when you want something familiar.  But unless you want a side of baby with your dinner, then sit in the bar during peak hours.  All of the items aren't very experimental, but good.  My boyfriend and I first ordered way overpriced drinks; he got a very tall beer, and I got their "famous" T.N.T. which was $7.99 (!!) and was basically a Long Island Iced tea.  Then we both got side salads.  They were decent, but we were over charged.  Our server did fix it without fuss though.  We weren't even done with our salads when they brought out our entrees.  That was a nice change.  You gotta love quick service.  I decided to try something different and got the Ribblets & Mac 'n' Cheese.  There wasn't much meat on the ribblets, but the mac and cheese made up for it.  My boyfriend got the Burnin' Love Burger, which wasn't all that burning. Overall, good food, good service, good atmosphere, but really overpriced for what you're getting.  Is it just me, or are all the chain restaurants blowing up their prices recently?

Good 'ole Red Robin. Nothing fancy, family friendly, good food, decent prices. Some days food and service is worthy of 5 stars, others maybe 2 stars. It just depends on the staff that day. But one thing that stays the same is my kids get fill their bellies filled with food they like, I get a break and we all leave happy. The place seems to be run fairly well. There are never any big issues to contend with.  The food is almost always cooked properly, staff is friendly enough and usually competent enough, and the joint seems clean enough. All very important to keep people like me coming back. Most everything they serve that I have tried is good; loaded in calories though! I stick to the salads usually these days.  I have only had negative issues with the food on a couple of occasions out of the hundreds of times I have eaten here. That isn't too bad.  As with most chain restaurants, it can be very loud, crowded and a lot of turn over with the staff. You really never know what you are going to get when you walk in the door. However, it's a quick and easy choice for families or large groups as there is something on the menu that should please almost everyone in your group.   The down side of Red Robin is the high calorie foods, lack of gluten free or organic foods and vegetarian options, lack of creativity in food preparation and cramped seating.  All of which are common problems with all chain restaurants unfortunately.

My all time FAVORITE Restaurant!!! I LOVE Red Robins, the food is always good! The atmosphere is always Friendly and Jumping! One of my Favorite Items to order is of course their CLUCKS and Fries, but lately I have been in LOVE with there Ceaser Chicken Wrap and There BBQ Chicken burger which you can order with a heathier choice of Bun and a heathier side such as Fruit which is what I do! Decent prices and great food always keeps me coming back!

I'm not sure why this restaurant has two stars, maybe as more current reviews come in it will average out to the one star it barely deserves.  As many others have said service is extremely slow the bussing  is slow so you have to eat amidst a pile of dirty dishes and leftover food.  French fries are usually cold and there is no point in ordering the "bottomless fries" because you will be done eating before they ever arrive.  At the very least you would like to say that the staff is friendly, but they are not! If you're in that area and need a substitute chain restaurant, we now much prefer Shari's, next door.
